intro: Hibbertia tontoutensis, commonly known as the Tontouta hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers with prominent stamens. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is found in arid or semi-arid regions. Hibbertia tontoutensis has narrow, linear leaves and produces fruit that is a capsule containing numerous seeds. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
